intro: Xyris pocockiae, commonly known as Pocock's yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the genus Xyris, which includes about 200 species of flowering plants commonly referred to as yellow-eyed grasses. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and other moist habitats, preferring full sun to partial shade. Xyris pocockiae is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining wetland ecosystems.
